intro: Azedarach sempervirens f. longifoliola, commonly known as the Chinese silk tree, is a variant of the Persian silk tree characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. This plant is native to China and is valued for its ornamental appeal, featuring showy clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for temperate climates. The foliage remains evergreen in warmer regions, contributing to its aesthetic value throughout the year. Its unique leaf structure distinguishes it from other members of the Bignoniaceae family.
